title: Disassocating from the Influence of Past Conditioning | Sri Satya Gaura Chandra Dasa | SB 6.9.23-25
speaker: HG Satya Gaura Chandra Dasa

segments.key_quote: Thus, we also expect the Lord to protect us from this dangerous condition.
segments.summary: HG Satya Gaura Chandra Dasa reads from Srimad Bhagavatam, explaining how the Lord has protected devotees in the past and expressing hope for similar protection in the present.

segments.key_quote: This is why we cannot understand who God is or see Him face to face.
segments.summary: The speaker explains why conditioned souls cannot see God, even when He appears before them, because they falsely believe themselves to be independent controllers.

segments.key_quote: Because we think that we are also an independent controller.
segments.summary: The speaker provides the context of the verses, explaining that the demigods are offering prayers to the Lord because they are bewildered by the power of a demon.

segments.key_quote: How is it that the smallest, the living entity that we see, is exhibiting such a powerful intelligence, and skill?
segments.summary: The speaker uses the example of ants, highlighting their complex behaviors like seed preservation and surgery, to illustrate the presence of a universal intelligence.

segments.key_quote: So, one has to understand that there is an energy which is actually working in this world.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that the intelligence observed in nature, like in the ant society, points to a universal intelligence ultimately coming from Krishna.

segments.key_quote: One should see this tremendous intelligence which is all pervading in this universe.
segments.summary: The speaker shares a personal anecdote about observing a squirrel's quick escape from a predator bird, highlighting the all-pervading intelligence in the universe.

segments.key_quote: It's possible only by that energy. There is a different energy which is controlling these hands and legs and all my senses and sense objects. It's not me. I'm only seeing.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that our bodies are made of material energy, and we are merely seers within, with movements controlled by Krishna's external energy and directed by the Supersoul.

segments.key_quote: If you understand that all these things are i'm able to see means i'm separate from all this.
segments.summary: The speaker addresses the issue of unwanted thoughts, emphasizing that we are separate from them as seers, and that identifying with the body leads to unnecessary struggle.

segments.key_quote: Always remain fascinated by these fundamentals.
segments.summary: The speaker stresses the importance of remaining fascinated by fundamental spiritual truths and recognizing Krishna's direction behind all energy.

segments.key_quote: Every conditioned soul thinks that he is God.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that even demigods acknowledge Krishna as the supreme controller, while conditioned souls often falsely believe themselves to be God.

segments.key_quote: If we want to come out of the doership, then this is the secret. We should always recognize that Anusrujama Vishwam, my Lord, I am able to create this only because, you know, because of your direction or your intelligence.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that to overcome the illusion of being the doer, one must recognize that all creation is due to Krishna's direction, and that conditioned souls believe the world revolves around them.

segments.key_quote: The only counteraction to this Isha Manana is one single word that is called Seva on Mokha.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that the antidote to thinking oneself as God (Isha Manana) is selfless service (Seva) to Krishna, which leads to understanding and revelations.

segments.key_quote: We are subjected to follow innumerable conditions in our life.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the various degrees of conditioning that living entities experience, highlighting how those in Satva Guna have fewer conditions and greater clarity.
The speaker explains that devotees strive to rise to the level of Satva Guna through disciplined practice, which ultimately leads to happiness by avoiding future misery.

segments.key_quote: We should offer our services to Krishna in Sattva Guna.
segments.summary: The speaker uses the example of Indra's actions and their consequences to emphasize the importance of offering services to Krishna in Sattva Guna, avoiding harm and adhering to rules.

segments.key_quote: The crucial issue is, the Isha Manana, thinking that I am the, I am God, can be counteracted only by increasing our service, aptitude, wanting to do more and more, wanting to give more and more service to Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker reiterates that the key to counteracting the illusion of being God (Isha Manana) is to increase one's desire to serve Krishna.

segments.key_quote: As soon as we don't have any work, or we don't do any service, then comes Maya, knocks the door.
segments.summary: The speaker answers a question about the relationship between divine consciousness and detachment, explaining that a devotee absorbed in service is liberated, but Maya attacks when one is idle.

segments.key_quote: Bewilderment comes only because when you think, I am this body.
segments.summary: The speaker answers a question about bewilderment, explaining that it arises from identifying with the body and that the counteraction is to focus on being a spirit soul and servant of Guru and Krishna.

segments.key_quote: Devotees, we become fascinated and we become detached.
segments.summary: The speaker answers a question about artificial intelligence, explaining that devotees should be fascinated by it as an expression of Krishna's intelligence but detached in the sense of using it for Krishna's service under proper guidance.
